summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackDermalogica's Biolumin-C Vitamin C Gel Moisturizer provides weightless hydration and gives skin a radiance boost for healthy-looking skin.
details: DetailsBenefitsBrightens the appearance of skin immediately and over timeKey IngredientsHighly-Stable Vitamin C Complex: helps boost bioavailability for brighter skin and improved barrier defenseSqualane and Hyaluronic Acid: deliver essential hydration to minimize the appearance of fine lines and wrinklesBioluminescence Flower Extract: provides an instant brightening effectPhytic Acid and Pumpkin Enzymes: support natural skin renewal with exfoliating propertiesResearch ResultsAfter 4 weeks* participants had:Brighter, more radiant skinA more even skin toneVisibly reduced fine lines + wrinkles*Clinical test, 35 subjects, 2 applications/day, 4 weeksResults may varyItem 2583209How To UseAfter cleansing and toning, apply over face and neck in light, upward strokes. Use twice daily, morning and night.IngredientsWater/Aqua/Eau, Glycerin, Squalane, Propanediol, Butylene Glycol, Ppg-24-Glycereth-24, Jojoba Wax Peg-120 Esters, Hydroxyethyl Urea, Trehalose, Aminopropyl Ascorbyl Phosphate, Allantoin, Hyaluronic Acid, Hydrolyzed Hyaluronic Acid, Hydrolyzed Jojoba Esters, Biosaccharide Gum-1, Ethylhexylglycerin, Sodium Pca, Sodium Levulinate, Ergothioneine, Beta-Carotene, Lactobacillus Ferment, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Centella Asiatica Extract, Chamomilla Recutita (Matricaria) Flower Extract, Glycyrrhiza Glabra (Licorice) Root Extract, Verbascum Thapsus Extract, Lactobacillus/Pumpkin Ferment Extract, Glycine Soja (Soybean) Oil, Citrus Aurantium Dulcis (Orange) Peel Extract, Citrus Paradisi (Grapefruit) Peel Oil, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Citrus Aurantium Bergamia (Bergamot) Fruit Oil, Raspberry Ketone, Jasminum Sambac (Jasmine) Flower Extract, Santalum Album (Sandalwood) Oil, Daucus Carota Sativa (Carrot) Root Extract, Bisabolol, Cystine, Glycine, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, Hydrolyzed Glycosaminoglycans, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Sodium Hyaluronate, Pentylene Glycol, Caprylyl Glycol, Tocopherol, Mannitol, Tetrasodium Glutamate Diacetate, Sodium Hydroxide, Phytic Acid, Citric Acid, Peg-40 Hydrogenated Castor Oil, C12-13 Pareth-3, Xanthan Gum, Sclerotium Gum, Polyacrylate Crosspolymer-6, Ascorbyl Methylsilanol Pectinate, Glyceryl Caprylate, P-Anisic Acid, Benzyl Glycol, Methylpropanediol, Sodium Benzoate, Potassium Sorbate, Limonene.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: After cleansing and toning, apply over face and neck in light, upward strokes. Use twice daily, morning and night.

reviews.headline: Will not buy again
reviews.comments: Leaves my face very greasy and no visible improvement in the past week. Wish I could return for my faithful Peter Thomas Roth but lost my receipt.

reviews.headline: Loooove it
reviews.comments: I have been using this for about two years now along with a cheap drugstore face wash. My skin is so much brighter! I also use a vitamin c serum with this. I  attached photos from 11 months ago to now! Big difference

reviews.headline: Overall a No
reviews.comments:
It's definitely hydrating but for the price it shouldn't rub off. Can't use under makeup. 

Smells nice and feels great when you put it on but the pilling is awful.

reviews.headline: Not a fan‚Ä¶
reviews.comments: I love the Biolumin C serum but this moisturizer pills when you put makeup over it. Disappointing.

reviews.headline: Not as expected
reviews.comments: I am a big Dermalogica fan, however, this product was a disappointment.  I cannot use it for daytime under my makeup as it causes a "pilling" effect as I apply my foundation.  I use it only at night before bedtime.  I use the Biolumin-C vitamin C SERUM under my eyes, morning and night, and love it.

reviews.headline: It's a no for me.
reviews.comments: This product is too expensive for it to peel all the way off when I put sunscreen on.

reviews.headline: Wow! Feels great on the skin
reviews.comments: I love this brand and have tried MANY different items, this one is new to me and I am in LOVE! The consistency is just perfect, not too greasy and absorbs well into skin. Wish they made in larger size.

reviews.headline: Leaves a subtle glow on your complexion
reviews.comments: The scent is perfect and the next day you are beautiful.

reviews.headline: Residue
reviews.comments: Smells very nice and I use the cleanser before putting this on. I do notice after a while, I'm left with a residue that comes off despite not wearing makeup. I have mixed feeling about it because of the residue.

reviews.headline: Seems to work well
reviews.comments: Really great serum. I mix it with the collagen one and it seems to be working so far.

reviews.headline: Good skin product
reviews.comments: Light weight

reviews.headline: The Best Results
reviews.comments: One of the few skincare products I've actually noticed results from. My face is slightly sticky after applying, but that eventually goes away. I'm on my 3rd bottle now, and my skin tone is more even and brighter from using this moisturizer every morning. I LOVE it.

reviews.headline: Not worth it
reviews.comments: Got samples of this and the vitamin c serum and despite it being brightening, it pills like crazy and made me look like an oil slick. Save your money!!

reviews.headline: I love it
reviews.comments: The tackiness goes away after awhile. Despite that, I love it! It also helped clear out my skin!

reviews.headline: So far so good
reviews.comments: I have been using this product every morning for almost a month now and i can say i have seen some brightness of my skin hyperpigmentation i always make sure to follow up with a sunscreen so thats i can see results faster so far so good üëçüèΩ

reviews.headline: Holy grail daily moisturizer
reviews.comments: Yes yes yes!! So many pros and positives to this, I use it AM and PM. Love it so much!

reviews.headline: Love hate relationship but overall great
reviews.comments: I love all of Dermalogica products. This is like a mix of a cream serum compound to me but a cream texture. I have a tiny face and it takes two pumps to get the adequate amount I need for my face and neck. It dries on the skin very quickly but not dries like you cant feel it, dries like you can't spread it. So you have to get it everywhere you want quickly. Then it is very tacky so it should be the last thing you apply. If you apply anything afterwards you will get pilling. All that being said it does wonders for my skin. Leaves my skin glowing and fresh after i use it. It plumps it up and helps my pores as well skin texture. Its an amazing vitC face product. I find it hard to fall in love with vitC skincare products but always want to have one in my regimen. This has been the only one that truly does everything it promises to do. It does have some cons but i just dont use it on days I'm planning on wearing makeup. If you are a daily makeup wearer id recommend using it either hours before or in the evening. You get a good amount for the price. Its got a nice dispenser. Overall i give 5 stars cause not everything can be completely perfect in every aspect but if you get what you want from it can you really be upset.

reviews.headline: Extremely sticky
reviews.comments: It does not feel weightless. It makes me skin feel sitcky and stiff/tight. I dont like the feel of it.

reviews.headline: THIS!!! Best vitamin c ever
reviews.comments: I have been looking for a moisturizing vitamin c product, and this product is by far my favorite. I actually use this as a serum, and I put the Dermalogica Age Smart SPF 50 on top of it. It lasts way longer that way and the moisturizing effect is insane. I am obsessed - Dermalogica has done it again!

reviews.headline: Too heavy, best as a night cream
reviews.comments: I put on makeup a couple hours after applying and it totally clashed with my tinted moisturizer, the texture was awful and it's very scented too

faceoff_positive.comments: This product was gifted by Dermalogica to test out...here's what I thought. (For reference I'm 42, have dry/combo skin, and discolored spots from sun damage.)  It has a strong first scent of orange/citrus when first pumping it out but afterward smells herbal-y. It was a strange scent change since I couldn't detect an orange scent on my hands afterward, just the herbal smell. It happened every time and I still haven't figured out what magic does this. It's not unpleasant but I wanted to mention it just in case someone else wonders if they had a stroke.  I expected a gel but it's actually a light cream. I was pleasantly surprised because I was wondering if a gel would be enough moisture for my dry-ish skin. It felt really good going on, soothing and cool. I did not use a moisturizer on top in order to really test it.  The first thing I noticed (after a few days) is that I didn't need to exfoliate as often as usual. If you have dry skin you'll know what I mean; The dry skin kind of builds up and needs a good exfoliation or your skin will look dull. It really worked to chemically exfoliate, so no scrubbing was needed.  Using it twice a day, my skin felt fine. I didn't dry out or get itchy. It's a good lightweight hydrator but I know I'll need something more nourishing in the cold weather. I also noticed after around a week that my dark spots looked a little more faded and my complexion is a little more even.   Overall this is a really good product that performs the way it says it will, which should be the norm but often isn't. I liked getting the 3-in-1 of a chemical exfoliant and dark spot corrector inside a hydrating moisturizer. It could definitely cut down on the amount of product I usually buy for my skincare routine. I'll for sure keep using it!
faceoff_positive.headline: It works! (wild, right?)

faceoff_negative.comments:
I love vitamin C serums and creams. I have about three that are my favorites and I'm always trying to find something new. Unfortunately, this serum/ gel moisturizer is loaded with a lot of photosensitizing ingredients, fragrance, and unnecessary ingredients that detract from the product. Strong fragrance has no place in face products. My husband could smell me approaching after I put this on. It smells great, but it's not worth the migraine. This product immediately bring me and gave me a headache from the strong scent. I don't react this way to the other vitamin C products that I have, so I don't understand why I react so strongly to this. It's not like vitamin C is a new product to my face. Vitamin C is a product that should be more during the day, but some of these ingredients are known to cause reactions when combined with the sun. Why on earth would they be in this product? Here are some of the culprits: Citrus Aurantium Dulcis (Orange) Peel Extract, Citrus Paradisi (Grapefruit) Peel Oil, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Citrus Aurantium Bergamia (Bergamot) Fruit Oil, Raspberry Ketone, Jasminum Sambac (Jasmine) Flower Extract, Santalum Album (Sandalwood) Oil,

My skin burned immediately upon contact with the serum. I tried to wait it out to see if I can get better, but then I developed hives. I still have them even after several hours and a Benadryl. I didn't even go in the sun, so I can't imagine how horrible the reaction would be if I had done that.

I received this product for free.
faceoff_negative.headline: Highly scented. Photosensitizing ingredients. Migraine
